definition: to grasp/to hold/to operate/to manage/to control/to steer/to exercise/to drill (practice)/to play/to speak (a language)
to hold/to grasp/to support/to maintain/to persevere/to manage/to run (i.e. administer)/to control

sentences.english: A lovely couple presides over this spick-and-span operation.
sentences.chinese: 一對可愛的夫妻操持着這一嶄新的設施。
我可沒有操持農事的本事。

sentences.english: Many men do not appreciate how much work it takes to keep house and cook three meals a day .
sentences.chinese: 許多男人不理解操持家務和一天做三頓飯要幹多少活。

sentences.english: The first incision is something few physicians forget.
sentences.chinese: 很少有內科醫生會忘記他們的操持的第一刀。

sentences.english: Most Pakistanis also see this as America’s war.
sentences.chinese: 大多數巴基斯坦人都認爲美國操持着這場戰爭。

sentences.english: I'll leave the matter in your hands.
Who runs his house for him since his wife is ill?
sentences.chinese: 由於他妻子生病了，誰來替他操持家務呢？

sentences.english: When I'm not working in the house, I like to go outside and work in my vegetable garden.
sentences.chinese: 我不做家務的時候，我喜歡到戶外，操持我的菜園。

sentences.english: The funeral rites, orchestrated by the widow, were conducted by Buddhist monks.
sentences.chinese: 未亡人貝格請來佛教僧人操持了葬禮。

definition: to take care of/to raise money/to attend to (guests, customers etc)
to tax one's mind and body/demanding (work)/dedicated (worker)/hard-working
to take care of/to sort out/to manage/to put in order
to bribe/to get (luggage) ready/to put in order/to organize things/(baseball) RBI (run batted in)
to tend/to take care of sb
making an all-out effort (idiom); to try one's heart out/to do one's utmost
